have on.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to be wearing a piece of clothing or type of clothing
have on.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: He had his best suit on.
Jimmy had nothing on but his socks.
have on.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if you have your television, radio etc on, you have switched it on and it is working
have on.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Billie has the radio on all day long.
have on.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to be trying to make someone believe something that is not true, especially as a joke
have on.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Don’t believe a word he says. He’s having you on!
have on.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to have arranged to do something, go somewhere etc, especially when this means you cannot do something else
have on.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Sorry, I can’t help you this weekend – I’ve got too much on already.
have on.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to know about something bad that someone has done
have on.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: What do the police have on him?
have on.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to not be nearly as good as someone or something else
have on.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: Rock ‘n’ roll has got nothing on these African rhythms.
